parts.title: Part 1: Essay
parts.instructions: Write an essay on the given topic.
passage: Climate change refers to long‑term shifts in temperatures and weather patterns.
Human activities, especially the burning of fossil fuels, have been the main driver of climate change.
The consequences include rising sea levels, more extreme weather events, and loss of biodiversity.

passage.label: Evaporation
passage.detail: Water from oceans and lakes turns into vapor and rises into the atmosphere.

passage.label: Condensation
passage.detail: Water vapor cools and forms clouds.

passage.label: Precipitation
passage.detail: Droplets in clouds fall back to earth as rain, snow, or hail.

parts.title: Part A: Letter Writing
parts.instructions: Write a formal letter to your local council about a community issue.
passage: You have been asked to write to the council because your neighborhood lacks green communal areas.
Describe the benefits of having a community garden, including social, environmental, and health aspects.
Suggest three possible locations and explain why each would be suitable.
Invite council members to a site visit and community open day.

parts.title: Part B: Report Writing
parts.instructions: Analyze the data provided and write a concise report.

parts.title: Part C: Creative Writing
parts.instructions: Craft a short story based on the prompt below.
passage: Imagine a library that only opens at midnight.
Describe the first visitor and the book they choose.
Explore how the book’s story begins to blur lines with reality.
Conclude with the visitor’s decision: to stay lost in the pages or return to the world outside.
